faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
Introduction. Knowledge and technology transfer, commercialisation of R&D and academic entrepreneurship
Business and Technology Intelligence (B&TI) and feasibility studies.
Academic entrepreneurship. Venture Opportunity, Concept, and Strategy. 
Entrepreneurial and innovation process. 
Internationalisation and business models of technology firms.
Introduction of experiences of technology entrepreneurs. 
Cases in technology entrepreneurship
description.et:
Sissejuhatus. Teadmus- ja tehnoloogiasiire, T&A kommertsialiseerimine ja akadeemiline ettevõtlus.
Firmade ja sektori äri- ja tehnoloogiainfo hankimine ja teostatavus-tasuvusuuringud.
Ettevõtlus- ja innovatsiooniprotsess.
Tehnoloogiafirmade rahvusvahelistumine ja ärimudelid.
Tehnoloogia-ettevõtjate kogemuste tutvustus. 
Tehnoloogiaettevõtluse kaasused.

objectives.en: Aim of the course is to give an overview of feasibility study and commercialisation of R&D project in technology sector, including overview of contemporary knowledge- and technology-based academic entrepreneurship, business models, sectoral differences, knowledge transfer and internationalisation, investment opportunities, role of intellectual property, product development etc. Own experience is shared by (academic) entrepreneurs in the technology sector, scientists and experts of technology transfer.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärgiks on anda ülevaade T&A projekti teostatavus-tasuvus-analüüsi (TTA) metoodikast ja kommertsialiseerimisest tehnoloogiasektoris, sealhulgas ülevaade kaasaegsest teadmus- ja tehnoloogiapõhisest akadeemilisest ettevõtlusest, ärimudelitest, sektoraalsetest erinevustest, teadmussiirdest ja rahvusvahelistumisest, tehnoloogiaettevõtete rahastamisest, intellektuaalomandi rollist, tootearendusest, jne. Oma kogemusi vahendavad tehnoloogiasektoris tegutsevad (akadeemilised) ettevõtjad, teadlased ja tehnosiirde eksperdid.

learning_outcomes.en:
A. KNOWLEDGE, the students get:
- understanding of the socioeconomic potential of R&D projects, specific features and challenges of academic (technology) entrepreneurship, spin-off entrepreneurial processes, R&D collaboration with firms.  
- overview of the sectoral development legitimacy of technology business in Estonia and worldwide, trends on the market. 
- business opportunities in Estonia and globally.

B. SPECIAL SKILLS AND COMPETENCES, the student:
Understands feasibility study of R&D projects, business concepts of technology firms, commercialisation of R&D, protection and licensing of technology know-how. 

C. KEY SKILLS AND COMPETENCES, the student:
- can analyse and shape socioeconomic efficiency of R&D project through the knowledge transfer and spin-off entrepreneurial process.
- can analyse and shape technology- and knowledge-based entrepreneurial process, and strategy and business models for technology firms.
learning_outcomes.et:
A. TEADMISED
Üliõpilasel on:
- arusaamine T&A projektide sotsiaalmajanduslikust potentsiaalist, akadeemilise (tehnoloogia)ettevõtluse eripäradest ja väljakutsetest, teadmus- ja tehnosiirdest, spin-off ettevõtlusprotsessist, T&A koostööst ettevõtetega; 
- ülevaade tehnoloogiaettevõtete arengu sektoraalsetest seaduspärasustest, ettevõtete olukorrast maailmas ja Eestis, trendidest turul; 
- ülevaade ärivõimalustest Eestis ja globaalselt.
	
B. ERIALASED OSKUSED JA PÄDEVUSED
Üliõpilane orienteerub T&A ning tehnoloogiaprojektide TTAs, tehnoloogiaettevõtte ärikontseptsioonides, T&A kommertsialiseerimises, oskusteabe kaitses ja valdkonna põhimõistetes 

C. VÕTMEOSKUSED JA PÄDEVUSED
Üliõpilane:
- oskab analüüsida ja kujundada T&A projekti sotsiaal-majanduslikku tasuvust läbi teadmussiirde ja spin-off ettevõtluse protsessi;
- oskab analüüsida ja kujundada ettevõtte strateegiat ja äriplaani ning ärimudelit tehnoloogia ettevõttes.

independent_work.et: Feasibility study for R&D project. Instructions will be uploaded into SIS in the beginning of the course (after consultations of needs by students).

grade_preconditions.et: Uploading the assignment into Moodle - three days before prelim.

grade_evaluation.et: 20 - seminar general contribution, 10 - presentation of selected theme, 20 - participation, 50 - opportunity assessment/feasibility study. Delay decreases grades: up to 7 days - 5 points, over 7 days - 10 points.

structural_unit.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.et:
1.  L/S Introduction. Knowledge and technology transfer, and academic entrepreneurship

*	R&D management at university and company
*	Business Intelligence (BI), Technology Intelligence (TI) and Feasibility study
*	Developing and Protecting Intellectual Property (IP)
*	R&D in high technology small firm (HTSF)
*	Commercialisation of IP 
*	IP strategy: Startup, SME, university
*	Entrepreneurial university
*	Scientists and engineers - uniquely positioned to launch new business ventures based on cutting-edge discoveries.

2. L/S Academic entrepreneurship. Venture Opportunity, Concept, and Strategy. 

*	Concept of Academic Entrepreneurship 
*	Entrepreneurship and economic development; entrepreneurial ecosystem, components, sectoral aspects
*	Technology Entrepreneurship in the Global Economy, HTSF
*	Opportunity and the Concept Summary 
*	Vision and the Business Model
*	Competitive Strategy

3. L/S Entrepreneurial process 

*	General schema of entrepreneurial/startup process
*	Stages of the entrepreneurial process
*	Prior competencies and intention
*	Idea development and new venture idea
*	Concept development and opportunity confidence
*	Business development and venture launch
*	Entrepreneurial journey
*	Recognizing and shaping of an opportunity
*	Analyzing product/service design and protection 
*	Proof of concept: a new approach to business plans, lean startup, technology platform
*	Choosing the legal form of organization
*	Launching Technology Ventures

4.	L/S Business intelligence and feasibility studies

*	Competitiveness/industry analysis and market research
*	Sources of information, analysis, prognosis
*	IP role and patenting strategy
*	Measurement of R&D effect. Social return of investment
*	Sectoral peculiarities

5.	L/S Internationalisation and business models

*	Internationalisation and globalisation, internationalisation trajectories
*	International new venture (INV), "born global" concept 
*	Funding a rapidly growing venture
*	Planning for growth
*	Funding a startup venture

6.	L/S Experiences in technology entrepreneurship 

*	Planning startup operations
*	Developing a startup marketing plan 
*	Designing an entrepreneurial organization
*	Funding a startup venture
*	Financial management & Control
*	Mergers and acquisitions 
*	Profit and harvest, IPO

7.	L/S Cases in technology entrepreneurship

*	Entrepreneurs
*	ICT SMEs, Estonian examples
*	Biotech SMEs 
*	Other...
